Interface BooleanVector

All Known Implementing Classes:
ArrayVector, BitVector
public interface BooleanVector
A vector of Boolean Values. The length of the vector is fixed when the vector is created and cannot be changed. Indexes of the vector start at 0. All vector elements are initialized to false.
Author:
Kevin Lillis

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    DEFAULT_LENGTH
    The default vector length used when no length is specified by the constructor.

    Returns the number of elements in this vector with a value of false.

    • toggleAll

      void toggleAll()
      Toggles all elements of this vector.

    • getTruePositions

      int[] getTruePositions()
      Returns an int array containing the indices of the vector elements that are true. The length of the returned array is the same as the number of true vector elements.
      Returns:
      an array containing the indices of the vector elements that are true.

    • getFalsePositions

      int[] getFalsePositions()
      Returns an int array containing the indices of the vector elements that are false. The length of the returned array is the same as the number of false vector elements.
      Returns:
      an array containing the indices of the vector elements that are false.

    • countTrue

      int countTrue()
      Returns the number of elements in this vector with a value of true.
      Returns:
      the number of elements with a value of true

    • countFalse

      int countFalse()
      Returns the number of elements in this vector with a value of false.
      Returns:
      the number of elements with a value of false

    • toString

      String toString()
      Returns a string showing the contents of this vector. The single letter "T" is used for true values and the letter "F" is used for false values. For example: [T, F, T, F]
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string showing the T/F values of this vector.
